section.title: Introduction
section.para: The coordinator will spend much of the time focusing on activity in the MI CIMS and keeping status updated in that application. This is the communication tool not only to the other agencies, but also to personnel in the affected area. It also provides critical documentation for the incident which is needed for the After Action Report, the SEOC SitRep for the operational period, and for any Federal or State aid that may be required following the incident.

section.title: Situation Report
section.para: The coordinator should establish an agency SitRep immediately on after notifying the affected jurisdictions. Navigate to SEOC Situation Report - Agency List and select AuxComm from the list.

warning.title: The Executive Summary will become part of the SEOC Situation Report
warning.para: Be sure to update that section of the agency SitRep each operational period and be sure that it is framed in such a way as to be useful as a part of the SEOC Situation Report. Other sections may be more specific, but the Executive Summary will be viewed by a wider audience.

section.title: Activity Log
section.para: Any significant occurrence, or even notes, should be recorded in the Activity Log. This is a log of our actions for later reference, and is private unless one of three boxes at the bottom of the board have been checked:

For any occurrence that should be brought to the attention of the SEOC staff, the appropriate box should be ticked. This will cause the record to be displayed on one of the other boards in addition to the Activity Log.

A new record in the Activity Log may be created by clicking the New Record button at the top of the board. Text may be added to the top of an existing record by clicking the Update Record button at the bottom of the record.
All records are timestamped. The timestamp for the creation of a new record appears to the left of the record. Each entry within the record has a timestamp at the bottom of the entry.

section.title: AuxComm Station Status
section.para: The coordinator should remind the station to maintain their status in the AuxComm Station Status board. Not only should current OPEN/CLOSED status and current frequencies be up to date, but any occurrences of interest should be recorded in the Situation Update section. Like other entries, additions to this section are timestamped.

section.title: AuxComm Message Log
section.para: The coordinator must also keep abreast of the AuxComm Message Log. The coordinator may enter messages in that board on receipt, or the station may initiate the entry. When the delivering station has MI CIMS access, then the delivering station should update the delivery details. However, it may often fall on the SEOC station to discover and record the delivery.

section.title: Situational Awareness
section.para: There are many other items within the MI CIMS that the coordinator must follow in order to stay up to date on the progress of the incident.

Most critical are the SEOC Significant Events board, the Statewide Significant Events board, and the the Local Significant Events board. Any time any of these turns red in the menu, the coordinator should check the board, understand the update, and potentially, notify the station. Chances are the station cannot follow all the significant events, so needs to be advised of anything of consequence to them. This, of course, includes the MARS station as well as the ARES station.
The coordinator must always be alert to the Battle Rhythm board. Typically this will be displayed on one of the large screens, but it notifies the coordinator of upcoming briefings.

The other available boards are useful, and at times, the various dashboards can be especially useful, and when possible the coordinator should stay up to date on all the boards, but the boards mentioned above are especially critical.
